skill.name: iso-13485-certification
skill.description: Comprehensive toolkit for preparing ISO 13485 certification documentation for medical device Quality Management Systems. Use when users need help with ISO 13485 QMS documentation, including (1) conducting gap analysis of existing documentation, (2) creating Quality Manuals, (3) developing required procedures and work instructions, (4) preparing Medical Device Files, (5) understanding ISO 13485 requirements, or (6) identifying missing documentation for medical device certification. Also use when users mention medical device regulations, QMS certification, FDA QMSR, EU MDR, or need help with quality system documentation.

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate ISO 13485 documentation toolkit for medical device manufacturers. All 404 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by pattern matching on documentation content. The Python script only reads/writes files locally and performs keyword analysis. No network access, credential access, or command execution.

content.value_statement: Medical device companies need comprehensive ISO 13485 documentation for quality management certification. This skill provides templates, gap analysis tools, and step-by-step guidance to create all required Quality Management System documents for FDA, EU, and global regulatory compliance.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes existing documentation against ISO 13485 requirements using the gap_analyzer.py tool
Provides templates for Quality Manual and 31 required documented procedures
Offers clause-by-clause guidance on ISO 13485:2016 requirements
Creates gap analysis reports showing missing documentation and compliance status
Supports regulatory transitions from FDA QSR to QMSR and EU MDR harmonization
Generates Medical Device Files with all required regulatory content
limitations: Does not provide legal or regulatory advice - consult qualified professionals for certification decisions
Templates require customization with organization-specific information before use
Does not replace formal ISO 13485 training or professional consulting services

prompt_templates.title: Getting started
prompt_templates.prompt: We are a medical device startup preparing for ISO 13485 certification. Walk me through the documentation requirements and help me understand where to start.

output_examples.input: What documentation do we need for ISO 13485 certification?
output: ISO 13485 requires three main documentation components:
â€¢ Quality Manual - foundational document describing QMS scope, processes, and interactions
â€¢ 31 Documented Procedures - covering risk management, design controls, purchasing, production, CAPA, audits, and more
â€¢ Medical Device Files - one file per device type with specifications, procedures, and validation records
Key priority documents: Quality Manual, Document Control, CAPA, Complaint Handling, Internal Audit, and Management Review procedures.
I can analyze your existing documentation to identify gaps or help you create specific templates.

best_practices: Start with Quality Manual before creating individual procedures - it establishes the QMS structure and references all other documents
Customize templates with organization-specific information - replace all placeholders with actual company names, addresses, and process details
Maintain consistency in terminology and document numbering across all QMS documentation for audit clarity
anti_patterns: Copying ISO 13485 standard text verbatim instead of describing your actual processes in your own words
Creating overly detailed procedures that should be in work instructions instead - procedures should define what needs to be done, not how to do it
Forgetting to document records - every procedure must specify what records to maintain and for how long

faq.question: How long does ISO 13485 certification take?
faq.answer: Typical implementation takes 6-12 months. Timeline depends on existing quality systems, organization size, and product complexity.

faq.question: What are the 31 required procedures?
faq.answer: They cover risk management, software validation, document/record control, management review, competence, design, purchasing, production, monitoring, CAPA, audits, and more.

faq.question: Can I combine multiple procedures?
faq.answer: Yes, ISO 13485 allows combining procedures. One document can address multiple clauses if logically organized and clearly referenced.

faq.question: What happens if I exclude a clause?
faq.answer: Exclusions (like design controls for contract manufacturers) must be justified in the Quality Manual and cannot affect product safety or regulatory compliance.

faq.question: How is ISO 13485 related to FDA QMSR?
faq.answer: FDA QMSR (effective Feb 2026) harmonizes 21 CFR Part 820 with ISO 13485. Key change: Medical Device File replaces separate DHF, DMR, and DHR.

faq.question: Do I need EU MDR documentation too?
faq.answer: EU MDR 2017/745 requires technical documentation beyond ISO 13485. This skill helps with ISO 13485 foundation; MDR-specific documentation requires additional content.
